channel.title: Dislocated my left pinkie
channel.description:
So in P.E. today, we're playing volleyball and this one chick who plays on like a nationally traveling volleyball team spikes it and it hits the left side of my hand like directly and dislocates my pinkie. It was bent at the hand out to the side. I managed to put it back in place (sort of), but when I put my hands out, the pinkie is a good inch and a half/2 inches from my ring finger.
Anyways, discuss injuries you've had like broken bones etc.

item.title: Dislocated my left pinkie
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

I have fell on a rake before. It was a while ago when I was a kid. We were playing tag and I tripped and my knee landed on the spikes of the rake. Didn’t hurt at the time but was pretty sore that night. The next day it got infected, left it and it got even more painful so I went to the doctor and shit and the rest I can’t really remember. I still got scars.

I have few injuries ever since.

Read full topic

item.title: Dislocated my left pinkie
item.dc:creator: @Logitek Logitek
item.description:
@Logitek wrote:

CoonHunter:

The worst injurie I have had is when I was like 7 (or 8ish?) I had a 7-speed bike that was given to me, and I didn’t realize it had no breaks until going down a hill (wow was i stupid for this next move), but, for some stupid reason, the best thing would be to jump off (bare with me for the next part) and hold onto the handle-bars so I could stop the bike. I ground my right knee down to nearly the bone in a small area. The real only medication that I can recall (as this has been over 10 years ago) was some kinda pain cream for the scratches and such around my legs.

was this pain cream white?(not what u think im talking about, im serious)
because when i was younger i slapped a hot burner and thats all my mommy used on me.

Read full topic

item.title: Dislocated my left pinkie
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Dislocated my shoulder in a snowmobile accident, tore my glenoidal labrum (a ligament that pretty much keeps your shoulder in one piece) but I didn’t know that I tore it at the time.
I managed to put it back in socket at the time, but it hurt like fuck.

A couple weeks after that, I was reaching under the couch to grab a sock and putting my weight on the same shoulder and it dislocated again. Had to go to to the ER and get morphine (which didn’t help the pain) and then get put to sleep for them to put it back into place. About a month after that, I was pulling a blanket up over my back while sitting at the computer and I dislocated the same shoulder a third time (same ER/morphine/put to sleep story).

Dislocating your shoulder fucking hurts.

After the third time, the doctor said that something was seriously wrong with my shoulder and I got a CT scan which revealed that my glenoidal labrum was torn. They scheduled me for surgery and put 4 screws into my shoulder to fix it/hold it back into place. It hasn’t dislocated since then, and it’s been about two years now. Pretty brutal.

Read full topic
